tit.j: 花山院定教 (左近衛中将)
tit.e: Sadanori KAZANIN (Sakon e no chujo [Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards])

sen.j: 花山院 定教（かざんいん さだのり、寛永6年10月1日 (旧暦)（1629年11月15日） - 承応2年12月12日 (旧暦)（1654年1月30日））は、江戸時代前期の公卿。
sen.e: Sadanori KAZANIN (November 15, 1629 - January 30, 1654) was a Kugyo (high court noble) who lived in the early Edo period.

sen.j: 明正天皇（109代）から後西天皇（111代）期の朝臣。
sen.e: Sadanori served at the Imperial Court under the reigns of Emperor Meisho (the 109th) through to Emperor Gosai (the 111th).

sen.j: 最終官位は従三位左近衛中将。
sen.e: Sadanori's final official rank was Jusanmi Sakon e no chujo (Junior Third Rank, Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).

sen.j: 藤原北家藤原師実流花山院家23代当主。
sen.e: Sadanori was the 23rd Head of the Kazanin family belonging to the FUJIWARA no Morozane line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.e: Sadanori was the second son of a Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) named Sadayoshi KAZANIN.

sen.j: 寛永20年（1642年）に元服し、左近衛中将に任命される。
sen.e: In 1642 Sadanori celebrated his coming of age (a ritual of Genpuku, meaning clothing initiation and the formal recognition of adulthood) and was appointed Sakon e no chujo.

sen.j: 正保3年（1646年）に従三位となり、慶安2年（1649年）には踏歌節会外弁をつとめたが、承応2年（1653年）に死去。
sen.e: Sadanori was raised to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1646, and served as a Toka no sechie Geben (a Kugyo who supervised the event of toka [ceremonial mass singing and stomp dancing] called Toka no sechie held at the Imperial Court on around the fifteenth day of the first month of the year, outside the Shomeimon gate of the Kyoto imperial palace) in 1649, before his death in 1653.
